= We archive wikis, from Wikipedia to tiniest wikis =

*!WikiTeam software is a set of tools for archiving wikis.* They work on !MediaWiki wikis, but we want to expand to other wiki engines. As of August 2012, !WikiTeam has preserved [AvailableBackups more than 4,500 wikis].

There are [http://wikiindex.org thousands] [http://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Sites_using_MediaWiki/en of] [http://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Sites_using_MediaWiki/multilingual wikis] in the Internet. Everyday some of them are no longer publicly available and, due to lack of [AvailableBackups backups], lost forever. Millions of people download tons of media files (movies, music, books, etc) from the Internet, implementing a kind of distributed backup. Wikis, most of them under free licenses, disappear from time to time because nobody grabbed a copy of them. That is a shame that we would like to solve.

*!WikiTeam* is the [http://www.archiveteam.org Archive Team] subcommittee on wikis. It was founded and originally developed by [https://sites.google.com/site/emijrp/ Emilio J. Rodríguez-Posada], a Wikipedia veteran editor and amateur archivist. Many people have help sending suggestions, [http://code.google.com/p/wikiteam/issues/list reporting bugs], writing [http://code.google.com/p/wikiteam/w/list documentation], providing help in the [http://groups.google.com/group/wikiteam-discuss mailing list] and making [AvailableBackups wiki backups]. Thanks to all, especially to: [http://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/User:Nemo_bis Federico Leva], Alex Buie, [http://www.sdboyd56.com Scott Boyd], [http://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/User:Hydriz Hydriz], Platonides, Ian !McEwen and Mike Dupont.

= Current events =
The last *news* (follow us on [http://twitter.com/#!/WikiTeamProject Twitter] too!):
  * 2012-08-06: [http://code.google.com/p/wikiteam/source/browse/trunk/uploader.py Uploader] script is finally coded and we start to make some test uploads before people launch it to upload the thousands TaskForce downloaded dumps.
  * 2012-06-07: The SpeedyDeletion tool has been running for some weeks collecting English Wikipedia articles to be deleted every 30 minutes. The articles are being saved at [http://archive.org/details/wikipedia-delete-2012-06 Internet Archive] and [http://speedydeletion.wikia.com speedydeletion.wikia.com].
  * 2012-05-17: Wikimedia projects dumps are now mirrored in [http://dumps.wikimedia.org/mirrors.html three different locations] around the globe. Very good news.
  * 2012-04-25: Steven Leeman archives [http://wiki.fon.com Fon wiki] ([http://www.webcitation.org/67BNif6yE WebCite]) and uploads it to [http://archive.org/details/wiki-wikifoncom_563 Internet Archive]. Thanks!
  * 2012-04-07: We start a TaskForce to archive 7,000+ wikis from a list by Andrew Pavlo (2009).
  * 2012-04-05: WikiTeam 1st Birthday! \o/
  * 2012-03-03: WikiTeam tools need a Graphical User Interface ([GUI]) to reach a greater community. We start to work on this.
  * 2012-02-27: We start to [http://www.archiveteam.org/index.php?title=Wikimedia_Commons archive Wikimedia Commons]. [http://code.google.com/p/wikiteam/source/browse/trunk/commonsdownloader.py Source code] and [http://toolserver.org/~emijrp/commonsarchive/ file lists] available. We are doing some tests.
  * 2011-12-16: Using WikiIndex semantic properties to generate a dynamic [http://wikiindex.org/index.php?title=List_of_wikibackups&action=purge List of wikibackups] with many work to do! We are recruiting, [http://groups.google.com/group/wikiteam-discuss/browse_thread/thread/2de4428e60fc64f5 we need a lot of help]!
  * 2011-12-02: http://15demayo.info/wiki/ went offline in an undefined moment in the past. It was about the 2011 Spanish Revolution protests. We [https://code.google.com/p/wikiteam/downloads/detail?name=15demayoinfo_wiki-20110723-history.xml.7z grabbed a copy] in July. Dude, our mission is an important one.
  * 2011-11-30: New backups of OpenSUSE and WikiIndex wikis sent by Hydriz are uploaded. Thanks!
  * 2011-11-10: Archive Team uploads to Internet Archive [http://www.archive.org/details/wikimedia-image-dump-2005-11 one of the last image dumps] published by Wikimedia Foundation. It contains 296,000 images in 77GB. What a great work.
  * 2011-10-27: [http://mirrors.sdboyd56.com/WikiTeam/index.html ScottDB wikibackups site] reaches 100 archived wikis milestone. Keep up the good work!
  * 2011-10-24: Ian McEwen sent us a dump of https://hampedia.org Thanks!

Thanks to Centro de Computação Científica e Software Livre (C3SL), at the Universidade Federal do Paraná in Brazil!!!
  * 2011-10-13: ScottDB has written a [NewTutorial]. Enjoy!
  * 2011-10-10: We open a [http://code.google.com/p/wikiteam/wiki/ToDo ToDo] page where you can add all your wishes for new wiki archiving tools. For bugs, remember you can use [http://code.google.com/p/wikiteam/issues/list the issues section].

Read [News older news]. For a more detailed action log, see http://code.google.com/p/wikiteam/updates/list.

= What can you do? =
You can do *a lot of* things:
  * Read our [FAQ]
  * Download our [http://code.google.com/p/wikiteam/source/checkout scripts and software], read our [NewTutorial Tutorial] and backup your favorite wiki. Send us a copy of the backup if you want!
  * Download some [http://code.google.com/p/wikiteam/downloads/list?can=1 backups] of wikis. Additionally, there are more backups at [http://www.archive.org/search.php?query=subject%3A%22wikiteam%22 Internet Archive].
  * [http://code.google.com/p/wikiteam/issues/list Report a bug or request a feature]
  * Use the backups to [Research research] how wiki communities evolve
  * Subscribe to the mailing lists: [http://groups.google.com/group/wikiteam-discuss general discussion] and [http://groups.google.com/group/wikiteam-developers developer discussion]
  * Follow us on Twitter! [http://twitter.com/#!/wikiteamproject @WikiTeamProject]

= Research =
Are you a *researcher*? If you have conducted any [Research research] about wikis using our software or the backups we made available, we would be glad to hear from your experience. [Research Contact us].

This project contains a lot of material. *Be careful with the licenses*.
  * The [http://code.google.com/p/wikiteam/source/checkout source code] is [http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-3.0.html GPLv3]
  * The [http://code.google.com/p/wikiteam/w/list documentation] in this site is [http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/ Creative Commons 3.0 BY-SA]
  * Every [AvailableBackups backup] of every wiki has its own license. Visit the wiki and search for the license of texts and images. Read more in our [FAQ]

= Note =
Due to lack of space, we do not offer image dumps in Google Code. *The dumps only include the texts of the wikis (usually full histories).* Although you can run the script and generate your own backup which would contain all the texts and images (if you use _--xml_ _--images_ options).

= Contact =
If you want to *contact with the !WikiTeam community*, you can do it:
  * For bug reports, new features requests, notices about new wikis to backup: http://code.google.com/p/wikiteam/issues/list
  * General discussion about !WikiTeam tools and help for new users: http://groups.google.com/group/wikiteam-discuss
  * Developers discussion about bugs, patches, features: http://groups.google.com/group/wikiteam-developers
  * There is a social IRC channel in Efnet: irc://efnet/wikiteam ([http://chat.efnet.org:9090/?nick=&channels=%23wikiteam&Login=Login webchat access])

Also, [http://code.google.com/p/wikiteam/w/list every wiki page] allows to send comments.

If you want to contact using e-mail, you can send your messages regarding !WikiTeam to [mailto:emijrp@gmail.com emijrp@gmail.com].
